00:00:20:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:20:190000.Dialogue: We don't have Thai food on Thursday. We have pizza on Thursday.

00:00:23:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:23:170000.Dialogue: Yes, but we all agreed that the third Thursday of every month would be Anything Can Happen Thursday.

00:00:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:28:150000.Dialogue: Apparently the news didn't reach my digestive system, which, when startled, has it's own version of Anything Can Happen Thursday.

00:00:36:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:36:110000.Dialogue: Come on, the whole idea behind Anything Can Happen Thursday is to get out of this rut we've been in lately.

00:00:41:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:41:140000.Dialogue: Rut? I think you mean consistency. And if we're going to abandon that, then why even call it Thursday? Let's call it Quonko Day and divide it into 29 hours of 17 minutes apiece, and celebrate it by sacrificing a goat to the mighty god Ra.

00:00:57:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:57:120000.Dialogue: I could go for some goat.

00:01:01:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:01:110000.Dialogue: Sheldon, we agreed we'd do something different tonight.

00:01:05:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:05:020000.Dialogue: All right. Let's go to the comic book store.

00:01:09:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:09:160000.Dialogue: Last night was Wednesday. Wednesday is comic book night. Tonight, we'll be going on Thursday, because it's Anything Can Happen Thursday.

00:01:18:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:18:120000.Dialogue: Way to think outside but pressed right up against the box.

00:01:22:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:22:170000.Dialogue: So what are we going to do tonight?

00:01:24:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:24:180000.Dialogue: If I may proffer a suggestion, in bars all across this great nation of ours, Thursday night is Ladies' Night. Which means, as the evening progresses, we will get better looking courtesy of 99 cent margaritas and two-for-one Jell-O shots.

00:01:41:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:41:050000.Dialogue: Come on, Howard, the odds of us picking up girls in a bar are practically zero.

00:01:45:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:45:100000.Dialogue: Really? Are you familiar with the Drake Equation?

00:01:47:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:47:210000.Dialogue: The one that estimates the odds of making contact with extraterrestrials by calculating the product of an increasingly restrictive series of fractional values such as those stars with planets, and those planets likely to develop life? N equals R times FP times NE times FL times FI times FC times L?

00:02:11:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:11:090000.Dialogue: You can modify it to calculate our chances of having sex by changing the formula to use the number of single women in Los Angeles, the number of those who might find us attractive, and what I call the Wolowitz Coefficient.

00:02:30:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:30:020000.Dialogue: Crunching the numbers, I come up with a conservative 5,812 potential sex partners within a 40-mile radius.

00:02:41:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:41:170000.Dialogue: I never joke about math or sex.

00:02:46:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:46:070000.Dialogue: What are we waiting for? Let's bounce, bitches.

00:02:50:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:50:170000.Dialogue: You're right. It's Anything Can Happen Thursday. Let's hit the clubs and meet hot women!

00:02:55:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:55:160000.Dialogue: Here we go. Lock up your daughters! We're going to hit it and quit it.

00:03:05:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:05:220000.Dialogue: Or we could finish eating and go to the comic book store.

00:03:12:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:12:030000.Dialogue: But next Anything Can Happen Thursday, we're definitely going to a bar.

00:03:16:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:16:140000.Dialogue: You heard that, Ladies' Night ladies? We're eventually coming for you!

00:04:00:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:00:110000.Dialogue: What you have failed to take into account, is that this is Anything Can Happen Thursday.

00:04:08:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:08:130000.Dialogue: While you're there, could pick me up a few comics for my nephew's birthday?

00:04:11:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:11:170000.Dialogue: I think you mean comic books. Comics are feeble attempts at humor featuring talking babies and anthropomorphized pets found traditionally in the optimistically-named funny pages.

00:04:23:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:23:190000.Dialogue: Could you pick me up a few comics for my nephew's birthday?

00:04:28:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:28:010000.Dialogue: I don't know, he's 13. Just pick out anything.

00:04:33:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:33:040000.Dialogue: Maybe we can pick out a new suit for him without knowing his size. Or pick out his career for him without knowing his aptitude. Or pick out a new breakfast cereal without knowing his fiber requirements.

00:04:43:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:43:220000.Dialogue: Or his feelings about little marshmallows.

00:04:58:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:58:180000.Dialogue: You know this can go on all night. Why don't you just come with us?

00:05:03:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:03:060000.Dialogue: That's what I was trying to avoid.

00:05:22:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:22:190000.Dialogue: Don't worry, they're more scared of you than you are of them.

00:05:31:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:31:030000.Dialogue: Here, what about this one for my nephew?

00:05:35:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:35:170000.Dialogue: Provided he has already read Infinite Crisis and 52, and is familiar with the reestablishment of the DC multiverse.

00:05:49:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:49:030000.Dialogue: Come on, I'll help you pick something.

00:05:57:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:57:050000.Dialogue: Guys like that are so pathetic.

00:06:00:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:00:150000.Dialogue: Tell me about it. Look, a new Batman belt buckle.

00:06:07:120000.Speaker: Store clerk
00:06:07:120000.Dialogue: Hey, Leonard. Can I help you find something?

00:06:09:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:09:230000.Dialogue: Hey, Stuart. This is Penny. She's looking for some comic books.

00:06:12:150000.Speaker: Stuart
00:06:12:150000.Dialogue: Oh, really. Blink twice if you're here against your will.

00:06:19:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:06:19:210000.Dialogue: - Let me know if you need anything.

00:06:26:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:26:200000.Dialogue: You mean for someone who's into comic books?

00:06:34:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:34:010000.Dialogue: Just because people appreciate comic books doesn't make them weirdos. Stuart's a terrific artist. He went to the Rhode Island School of Design.

00:06:41:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:41:040000.Dialogue: What about the guy over there in the superhero T-shirt tucked into his sweatpants?

00:06:52:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:52:020000.Dialogue: He doesn't really help the point I'm trying to make.

00:07:17:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:17:030000.Dialogue: - Yes, but I saw it from the front.

00:07:20:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:20:150000.Dialogue: Come on! I need this for my Batman collection.

00:07:26:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:26:190000.Dialogue: Why would I gamble? It's mine. Let go.

00:07:31:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:31:120000.Dialogue: - He won't let go of my comic book.

00:07:41:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:41:120000.Dialogue: Hi. What would you recommend as a present for a 13-year-old boy?

00:07:48:200000.Speaker: Stuart
00:07:48:200000.Dialogue: But if you're dead set on a comic book, try... this.

00:07:56:010000.Speaker: Stuart
00:07:56:010000.Dialogue: A morally ambiguous confidence man who smokes, has lung cancer and is tormented by the spirits of the undead.

00:08:03:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:03:160000.Dialogue: If it doesn't make me the favorite aunt, I don't know what will.

00:08:19:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:19:140000.Dialogue: That's so sweet, but what if I didn't like it?

00:08:22:070000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:22:070000.Dialogue: It'd still be you, but I'd feel like an idiot.

00:08:26:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:26:150000.Dialogue: I don't believe it. Stuart's putting the moves on Penny.

00:08:30:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:30:060000.Dialogue: I have got to learn how to draw.

00:08:35:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:35:120000.Dialogue: Once again, defeated by your own prurient interests.

00:08:39:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:39:120000.Dialogue: Guys, have you seen Stuart all up in Penny's business over there?

00:08:43:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:43:080000.Dialogue: Nobody's up in anybody's business. Let's just buy our stuff and go.

00:08:47:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:47:090000.Dialogue: Okay, you've got my number. - Now, give me the picture.

00:08:49:110000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:49:110000.Dialogue: - You drive a hard bargain. But here.

00:08:54:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:54:140000.Dialogue: All right. So, just give me a call.

00:09:00:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:00:100000.Dialogue: So, Leonard, how are you enjoying Anything Can Happen Thursday?

00:09:09:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:09:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:09:020000.Dialogue: Look at that. That's a dent.

00:09:13:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:13:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:19:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:19:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:19:230000.Dialogue: Did you just shut the TV off in the middle of the classic Deep Space Nine/Star Trek: The Original Series Trouble With Tribbles crossover episode?

00:09:28:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:28:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:31:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:31:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:35:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:35:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:35:090000.Dialogue: All right. Then is it fair to say that you're experiencing some sort of emotional turmoil over the events involving Penny earlier this evening?

00:09:43:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:43:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:43:190000.Dialogue: When did you pick up on that?

00:09:46:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:46:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:46:230000.Dialogue: A moment ago, when you turned off the TV during the classic Deep Space Nine/Star Trek: The Original Series Trouble With Tribbles crossover episode.

00:09:57:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:09:57:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:00:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:00:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:02:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:02:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:02:010000.Dialogue: Then, this is the perfect time to launch a blog with an interactive comments section.

00:10:08:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:08:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:10:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:10:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:10:210000.Dialogue: Would you rather I offer my personal insight?

00:10:13:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:13:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:13:050000.Dialogue: I don't need any insights. I just want to know why Penny's more interested in Stuart than me. We're practically the same guy.

00:10:21:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:21:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:21:050000.Dialogue: I disagree. Stuart is taller, artistic, self-employed and, most significantly, he gets 45 percent off comic books.

00:10:34:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:34:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:34:200000.Dialogue: You're right. I really should be asking strangers on the Internet.

00:10:39:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon has the comic book.
00:10:39:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:44:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:44:040000.Dialogue: Chinese food, vintage video games... After the nightmare of Anything Can Happen Thursday, this is Friday night the way it was meant to be.

00:11:08:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:08:050000.Dialogue: Stuart has a piece in an art show that's opening tonight.

00:11:10:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:10:180000.Dialogue: And you guys are going together. Great...

00:11:14:070000.Speaker: Stuart
00:11:14:070000.Dialogue: It is great. Really great. Freaking awesome.

00:11:19:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:19:060000.Dialogue: - It's Friday night, Chinese food and vintage video games, right?

00:11:23:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:23:140000.Dialogue: Vintage doesn't even begin to describe what we have planned. Tonight, we are playing the classic 1980 interactive text adventure, Zork.

00:11:35:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:35:200000.Dialogue: Zork. Well, you guys have fun.

00:11:41:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:41:080000.Dialogue: Hey, Howard? Take me to a bar with women.

00:11:52:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:52:190000.Dialogue: Let me just go inside and slip off my underwear.

00:12:00:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:00:040000.Dialogue: Well, if I get lucky, I don't want to be caught in my Aquaman briefs.

00:12:13:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:13:200000.Dialogue: May I have a grasshopper with a little umbrella, please?

00:12:19:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:19:120000.Dialogue: I'm not sitting here with a guy drinking a grasshopper with a little umbrella.

00:12:24:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:24:220000.Dialogue: Fine. I'll have a chocolate martini.

00:12:30:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:30:220000.Dialogue: You know I can't talk to women unless I'm lit up like the Hindu festival of Devali.

00:12:40:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:40:030000.Dialogue: There are plenty of bars in Los Angeles where you can order grasshoppers and chocolate martinis, but you wouldn't have to because there are no women in them.

00:12:49:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:49:000000.Dialogue: Gotcha. I'll have a Brandy Alexander.

00:12:55:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:55:000000.Dialogue: All right, the Three Musketeers just became the Dynamic Duo.

00:12:58:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:58:220000.Dialogue: Should we talk to some of these women?

00:13:01:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:01:100000.Dialogue: It's way too early in the night for that. First we let the lawyers and the jocks thin the herd, and then... we go after the weak and the old and the lame.

00:13:16:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:16:180000.Dialogue: And if you spot a chick with a Seeing Eye dog, she's mine.

00:13:23:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:23:210000.Dialogue: Come on. I think it's nice that Captain Sweatpants showed up to your art opening.

00:13:30:020000.Speaker: Stuart
00:13:30:020000.Dialogue: Yeah, it would have been nicer if he hadn't touched all the cheese.

00:13:36:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:36:020000.Dialogue: You know, it's kind of early. Do you want to maybe come in for some coffee?

00:13:40:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:13:40:130000.Dialogue: Gee, it's a little late for coffee, isn't it?

00:13:44:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:44:230000.Dialogue: You think coffee, means coffee. That is so sweet.

00:13:49:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:49:110000.Dialogue: Come on. I think I have decaf.

00:13:51:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:51:180000.Dialogue: Good, Stuart. I thought I heard your voice. Do you have a moment?

00:14:01:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:01:160000.Dialogue: Isn't it a little late for coffee?

00:14:04:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:04:170000.Dialogue: It's okay. She thinks she has decaf.

00:14:11:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:11:180000.Dialogue: I'll just go look for it.

00:14:19:150000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:19:150000.Dialogue: - Yeah. Those guys can be very stubborn. - What's the topic?

00:14:23:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:23:050000.Dialogue: - I am asserting, in the event that Batman's death proves permanent, the original Robin, Dick Grayson, is the logical successor to the Bat Cowl.

00:14:31:200000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:31:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm afraid you couldn't be more wrong.

00:14:43:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:43:230000.Dialogue: Wrong is an absolute state and not subject to gradation.

00:14:48:190000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:48:190000.Dialogue: Of course it is. It's a little wrong to say a tomato is a vegetable. It's very wrong to say it's a suspension bridge.

00:14:56:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:14:56:130000.Dialogue: But returning to the original issue, Dick Grayson became Nightwing, a superhero in his own right. Batman 2 has to be the second Robin, Jason Todd.

00:15:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:04:230000.Dialogue: Has to be? Has to be? I hope you're being deliberately provocative.

00:15:26:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:26:150000.Dialogue: They're eating peanuts. And my allergies, one kiss would put me in Cedars-Sinai for a week.

00:15:34:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:34:050000.Dialogue: What about the ones in the corner?

00:15:36:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:36:200000.Dialogue: Possible. Very possible. You want the one in the whiplash collar or the one who keeps blinking?

00:15:47:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:47:090000.Dialogue: Wait, so we just go over there?

00:15:50:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:50:030000.Dialogue: We have a little prep work to do. Put this in your mouth. We walk past them, you stumble a bit. I say, sorry, my friend's had a little too much. And then I start to pull it out of your mouth.

00:16:01:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:01:030000.Dialogue: And say, A little too much fun.

00:16:05:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:05:100000.Dialogue: Get it? They're laughing, we're laughing. Then we get them up to about a .15 blood alcohol level, and tell them we're millionaires.

00:16:16:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:16:200000.Dialogue: Depends. Are you willing to sit on my lap and pretend to be a ventriloquist dummy?

00:16:22:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:22:110000.Dialogue: I can't sit on your lap. You don't know the routine.

00:16:28:080000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:28:080000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, but you're obviously stuck in a pre-Zero Hour DC universe.

00:16:32:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:32:110000.Dialogue: Of course I am. Removing Joe Chill as the killer of Batman's parents effectively deprived him of his raison d'\EAtre.

00:16:39:150000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:39:150000.Dialogue: Throw all the French around you want, it doesn't make you right.

00:16:46:080000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:46:080000.Dialogue: Plus, you're forgetting that the Infinite Crisis storyline restored Joe Chill to the Batman mythology.

00:16:51:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:51:170000.Dialogue: I am forgetting nothing and I resent your tone.

00:16:57:010000.Speaker: Stuart
00:16:57:010000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, it's late. I've got to get some sleep.

00:17:09:190000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:09:190000.Dialogue: Penny, I really had a terrific time...

00:17:17:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:17:070000.Dialogue: She'll maul you like a rabid wolverine.

00:17:22:200000.Speaker: Stuart
00:17:22:200000.Dialogue: You know, I don't think that was decaf.

00:17:29:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:29:040000.Dialogue: Wait. Is this your card or isn't it?

00:17:35:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:35:080000.Dialogue: Trust me. This was their card.

00:17:37:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:37:130000.Dialogue: I thought you were good at this. You're always talking about how you go to bars and meet women.

00:17:44:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:44:110000.Dialogue: Well, what happened? We've been sitting here all night and the longest conversation you've had with a woman was when your mom called.

00:17:56:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:56:170000.Dialogue: You're just going to make me come out and say it?

00:18:05:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:05:070000.Dialogue: I'm a falcon who hunts better solo.

00:18:09:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:09:030000.Dialogue: Fine. I'll sit here. You take flight and hunt.

00:18:14:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:14:110000.Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous. You can't tell a falcon when to hunt.

00:18:21:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:21:130000.Dialogue: There's a whole sport built around it.

00:18:32:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:32:060000.Dialogue: Let's just get Koothrappali and go.

00:18:45:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:45:020000.Dialogue: It's got to be that stupid accent of his.

00:18:50:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:50:080000.Dialogue: Hello. I am Sanjay Wolowitz from Bombay.
